data.text: @peta I understand that the environment that the local zoos put their animals in aren't comfortable or meet all their needs, but you can't just throw them out into the wilderness. Even putting in a preserve that forbids hunting animals, wouldn't keep them safe from lawless poachers.

@peta Not to mention the loss of habitat for the past decades. Leaving giraffes out in the wild would lead to their extinction due to the hands of unforgiving opportunists without any means of protection. I personally would much rather live imprisoned over dying.

@peta You're completely right I do feel sick. Sick because the people following your movement don't even research for five minutes about the topic. Giraffes have a lower population than elephants at this time. This isn't because they are killed by their natural predators but poaching.

@peta I know the asshole who owns this place. He's an opportunistic dirtbag and Animal Adventure is NOT a real acredited zoo. It's an overgrown petting zoo at best and his "exotic animal keeping experience" has a questionable degree of legitimate success. He's a paper tiger, folks.
